benchmark_details.name: Full-Duplex-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Full-Duplex-Bench is a benchmark designed to evaluate critical aspects of full-duplex spoken dialogue models, focusing on interaction dimensions such as pause handling, backchanneling, smooth turn-taking, and user interruption management.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic and reproducible evaluation framework for full-duplex spoken dialogue models.

data.source: Candor and ICC datasets, along with synthetic data generated using GPT-4o.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the analysis of time-aligned transcriptions and recorded interactions.
methodology.interpretation: Lower TOR indicates better management of user turns, and higher frequencies of backchanneling suggest more engaged dialogue.
methodology.validation: The benchmark has been systematically tested against various full-duplex models.
